page.title: 09ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS
page.content: The historic town centre of Baldock, suffers severely from traffic problems. Although a bypass A1(M) has now been provided for the Great North Road, traffic leaving the A1(M) and traffic on the A505, travelling to East Anglia, passes through the town. A bypass to provide relief has been proposed since the early 1970's, but economic problems and disagreement over the route, have resulted in no action to date, although there is now a firm proposal for a route to bypass the town to the north. Two public consultation exercises have been held. The wide High Street is used as an overnight stopping point for commercial vehicles, and as a rest point for long distance coaches. Residents complain of the noise and disturbance caused by these vehicles.
